If you're saying "Crypto is bad for ransomware," that's backwards. If you're saying "crypto makes certain bad behaviors inherently possible," true, just like cash, and if it's a small percent and cannot be helped, I'm not concerned. The type of mining can be helped/picked though.
Non-ASIC cryptocurrencies provide an incentive for malware mining, and associate crypto with hacking and illegal & unethical behavior.
CPU mining provides incentives to people to hack and coopt other people's machines, which in turn causes regular people to associate cryptocurrencies with bad behavior.

Expectations -- that is one of the biggest problems with the crypto community. What major international corp wants BTC to be their currency when the price to transact is $2MM. Already global corps are developing semi-public coinage.

Cryptomaniacs (I use the term endearingly) must realize there remains serious problems for distributed ledger block chain to solve to become global standard for global finance and store of value. Over time there will solutions.

Millennials embrace $ BTC et al, in part, as reaction to $217 Tril of global debt and massive wealth inequality forced upon them by Gen X and B-Boomer parents and grandparents. Cryptos are statement: "There must be a better way"
There is far more to my life than markets. I trade to live -- not live to trade. In the cosmic and eternal scope of creation crypto markets are meaningless.
